alert.note: Alert for Orange; Rockland (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 7:54PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF ORANGE AND ROCKLAND COUNTIES THROUGH 845 PM... At 753 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Florida to near Warwick to near Greenwood Lake to near Sloatsburg. Movement was north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations that could be impacted include... Middletown, Monroe, Walden, Warwick, Goshen, Sloatsburg, Howells, Chester, Montgomery, Greenwood Lake, Florida, Harriman, Kiryas Joel, Woodbury, Scotchtown, Mechanicstown, Washingtonville, Maybrook, Slate Hill and Pine Bush. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
